font.marquee: Attention: Governor Reynolds announced that she is recommending that Iowa school districts continue closure until April 30 to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. All school buildings, events, practices, and activities are canceled until further notice.

h3.a: Welcome to the United Community School District

p.style: color: #000000; font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: normal; orphans: auto; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: auto; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;

span.span: The mission of the United Community School District is to ensure that each student will achieve the skills necessary to succeed in life. This will be accomplished by providing a student-centered educational community.

p.style: color: #000000; font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: normal; orphans: auto; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: auto; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;

div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 12:55 pm CDT

div.span: Sunny, with a high near 57. North wind around 10 mph.
A 10 percent chance of rain after 5am. Increasing clouds, with a low around 36. North northwest wind 5 to 7 mph becoming calm.

A 30 percent chance of rain, mainly before 8am. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 63. Windy, with a west southwest wind 7 to 12 mph increasing to 17 to 22 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 32 mph.

p.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.p: The District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, gender, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. Any person inquiring about or seeking assistance with the Districts compliance with equity regulations may contact Dr. Pam Dodge, Interim Superintendent, who has been designated as the coordinator of the District. Efforts to comply with these regulations. pdodge@united.k12.ia.us | UCSD | 1284 U Ave, Boone, IA 50036 | 515-432-5319. Complaints can also be directed to the Iowa Civil Rights Commission, 400 E. 14th Street, Des Moines, IA 50319-1004, (515) 281-4121, or Region VII Office for Civil Rights, Citigroup Center 500 W.Madison Street, Suite 1475 Chicago, IL 60661-4544.
